% Source: content/research_experience.yaml

\SubHeadFirst{The Nookie Protocol: Genre Fusion at Scale}
{Limp Bizkit R\&D, Principal Investigator | 1994--2003}

\Desc{Multi-year research programme investigating the feasibility of fusing hip-hop vocal delivery, punk energy systems, and heavy metal instrumentation into a single reproducible audio output pipeline. Results shipped commercially as 'Significant Other' and 'Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water'---combined 30M+ units.}

\SubHead{Genre Fusion Pipeline Architecture}
\begin{treelist}
    \TreeItem{Designed a 4-input audio merge pipeline (vocals, turntables, guitars, rhythm section) with real-time crossfade and genre-weight parameters tuneable per track}
    \TreeItem{Achieved genre-blend ratios of 40\% hip-hop / 35\% metal / 25\% punk on 'Rollin'' and 'Nookie'---validated by 15M+ single sales and 200+ weeks on Billboard charts}
    \TreeLast{Pioneered DJ-integrated metal performance architecture with DJ Lethal, processing 120+ BPM turntable samples synchronised to drop-D guitar tuning in real time}
\end{treelist}

\SubHead{Large-Scale Audience Response Testing}
\begin{treelist}
    \TreeItem{Conducted the largest live audience stress test in nu-metal history at Woodstock '99: 400,000 concurrent participants, 72-hour sustained engagement window}
    \TreeItem{Measured peak crowd energy output during 'Break Stuff' at an estimated 2.4 MW of kinetic force across the mosh pit zone---the highest recorded metric for the genre}
    \TreeLast{Post-event analysis identified critical failure modes in venue crowd-flow architecture; published findings informally via MTV interview (1999)}
\end{treelist}

\SubHead{Cross-Platform Distribution \& Format Compatibility}
\begin{treelist}
    \TreeItem{Validated output compatibility across CD, cassette, MiniDisc, and early MP3 distribution channels simultaneously---one of the first acts to release a free MP3 single ('N 2 Gether Now') to drive physical sales}
    \TreeLast{Reverse-engineered Napster distribution metrics to quantify piracy impact; used data to negotiate improved royalty structures with Interscope}
\end{treelist}
